meanings.definition: Having the same boundaries or extent in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The two fields were coterminous, touching each other perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The coterminous countries shared a border that was exactly the same.
meanings.sent3: The coterminous houses looked like twins, standing side by side.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was coterminous, always together like shadows.
meanings.sent5: The coterminous colors of the sunset painted the sky in harmony.

meanings.sent1: The coterminous parks were separated only by a small fence.
meanings.sent2: The two coterminous properties had a fence running between them.
meanings.sent3: The coterminous trees leaned towards each other, almost touching.
meanings.sent4: Their interests were coterminous, always meeting at the same point.
meanings.sent5: The coterminous fields stretched as far as the eye could see, united by a common edge.
